short_summary: RIMNet Initiative Database Development and Analysis
description: The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission requires a contractor to complete the analysis task component of the RIMNet initiative. This includes performing a temporal and spatial analysis of monitoring data media and submitting a written report of the results.
duration_in_months: When this opportunity is selected, the contract shall be awarded through a Request for Proposal. A Request For Proposal is sought to seek participants from tenders through Analysis of Cash Flow , so I assume time  is between 12 to 18 months
full_summary:
### Request for Proposal
#### Database Development and Data Analysis of the Regional Information and Monitoring Network (RIMNet) - Ottawa River Watershed

#### Notice Information
- **Reference Number:** cb-751-91384818
- **Amendment Number:** 6
- **Solicitation Number:** 5000075513
- **Publication Date:** January 24, 2024
- **Tender Closing Date:** March 26, 2024, at 11:00:00 AM EST
- **Expected Contract Start Date:** April 1, 2024
- **Expected Contract End Date:** November 30, 2024

#### Notice Type and Solicitation Method

This is a request for proposal for a competitive open bidding procurement process. All proposals may be submitted with a selection criteria cote combinée la plus élevée pour le mérite technique et le prix (Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price).

#### Products and Services Required

- **UNSPC Code:** 81141901
- **Description:** Product research and development service
- **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC) requires a contractor to complete the analysis task component of the Regional Information and Monitoring Network (RIMNet) initiative. The scope of work includes the following:

- Conduct a temporal and spatial analysis of the provided data for multiple monitoring data media.
- Prepare and submit a written report summarizing the methodology and results of the analysis.

- The contract will be awarded based on the selection criteria of the highest combined rating for technical merit and price.

#### Contracting Entity

- **Contracting Entity Name:** Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission
- **Address:** 280 Slater Street, Ottawa, ON K1P 5S9
- **Phone:** (343) 542-6886
- **Email:** solicitation-demandedesoumission@cnsc-ccsn.gc.ca

#### Tender Documents and Attachments
Tender documents can be found at the following links:

_https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/30196/5000075513---rfp.pdf, https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/30196/5000075513---amendment-001.pdf, https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/30196/5000075513---amendment-002
